Functions.html#/c:@F@stringForSpeechMark.name: stringForSpeechMark
Functions.html#/c:@F@stringForSpeechMark.abstract: Fetches the string value for Speech Mark Type for the specified enum

Classes/AWSPollySynthesizeSpeechURLBuild.name: +defaultPollySynthesizeSpeechURLBuilder
Classes/AWSPollySynthesizeSpeechURLBuild.abstract: Returns the singleton service client. If the singleton object does not exist, the SDK instantiates the default service client with defaultServiceConfiguration from [AWSServiceManager defaultServiceManager]. The reference to this object is maintained by the SDK, and you do not need to retain it manually.

Classes/AWSPollySynthesizeSpeechURLBuild.name: +registerPollySynthesizeSpeechURLBuilder:forKey:
Classes/AWSPollySynthesizeSpeechURLBuild.abstract: Creates a service client with the given service configuration and registers it for the key.

Classes/AWSPollySynthesizeSpeechURLBuild.name: +PollySynthesizeSpeechURLBuilderForKey:
Classes/AWSPollySynthesizeSpeechURLBuild.abstract: Creates a service client with the given service configuration and registers it for the key.

Classes/AWSPollySynthesizeSpeechURLBuild.name: +removePollySynthesizeSpeechURLBuilderForKey:
Classes/AWSPollySynthesizeSpeechURLBuild.abstract: Removes the service client associated with the key and release it.

Classes/AWSPollySynthesizeSpeechURLBuild.name: -getPreSignedURL:
Classes/AWSPollySynthesizeSpeechURLBuild.abstract: Build a time-limited pre-signed URL to synthesize speech from Amazon Polly, return nil if build process failed.

Classes/AWSPollySynthesizeSpeechURLBuild.name: lexiconNames
Classes/AWSPollySynthesizeSpeechURLBuild.abstract: List of one or more lexicon names you want the service to apply during synthesis. For information about storing lexicons, see .

Classes/AWSPollySynthesizeSpeechURLBuild.name: languageCode
Classes/AWSPollySynthesizeSpeechURLBuild.abstract:
Optional language code for the Synthesize Speech request. This is only necessary if using a bilingual voice, such as Aditi, which can be used for either Indian English (en-IN) or Hindi (hi-IN).

If a bilingual voice is used and no language code is specified, Amazon Polly will use the default language of the bilingual voice. The default language for any voice is the one returned by the DescribeVoices operation for the LanguageCode parameter. For example, if no language code is specified, Aditi will use Indian English rather than Hindi.

Classes/AWSPollySynthesizeSpeechURLBuild.name: speechMarkTypes
Classes/AWSPollySynthesizeSpeechURLBuild.abstract: Input text to synthesize. If you specify ssml as the TextType, follow the SSML format for the input text.

Classes/AWSPollySynthesizeSpeechURLBuild.name: outputFormat
Classes/AWSPollySynthesizeSpeechURLBuild.abstract: Format to use for the resulting audio stream.

Classes/AWSPollySynthesizeSpeechURLBuild.name: sampleRate
Classes/AWSPollySynthesizeSpeechURLBuild.abstract:
The audio frequency specified in Hz.

The valid values for mp3 and ogg_vorbis are “8000”, “16000”, and “22050”. The default value is 22050.

Valid values for pcm are “8000” and “16000”. The default value is ???.

Classes/AWSPollySynthesizeSpeechURLBuild.name: text
Classes/AWSPollySynthesizeSpeechURLBuild.abstract: Input text to synthesize. If you specify ssml as the TextType, follow the SSML format for the input text.

Classes/AWSPollySynthesizeSpeechURLBuild.name: textType
Classes/AWSPollySynthesizeSpeechURLBuild.abstract: Specifies whether the input text is plain text or SSML. The default value is text. For more information about SSML, see examples-ssml-input.

Classes/AWSPollySynthesizeSpeechURLBuild.name: voiceId
Classes/AWSPollySynthesizeSpeechURLBuild.abstract: Voice ID to use for the synthesis. You can get a list of available voice IDs by calling the operation.

Classes/AWSPollySynthesizeSpeechURLBuild.name: expires
Classes/AWSPollySynthesizeSpeechURLBuild.abstract: The time when the signature expires, specified as an NSDate object.

Classes/AWSPollySynthesizeSpeechURLBuild.name: engine
Classes/AWSPollySynthesizeSpeechURLBuild.abstract: Specifies the engine (standard or neural) for Amazon Polly to use when processing input text for speech synthesis.

Classes/AWSPolly.html#/c:objc(cs)AWSPoll.name: configuration
Classes/AWSPolly.html#/c:objc(cs)AWSPoll.abstract: The service configuration used to instantiate this service client.

Classes/AWSPolly.html#/c:objc(cs)AWSPoll.name: +defaultPolly
Classes/AWSPolly.html#/c:objc(cs)AWSPoll.abstract: Returns the singleton service client. If the singleton object does not exist, the SDK instantiates the default service client with defaultServiceConfiguration from [AWSServiceManager defaultServiceManager]. The reference to this object is maintained by the SDK, and you do not need to retain it manually.

Classes/AWSPolly.html#/c:objc(cs)AWSPoll.name: +registerPollyWithConfiguration:forKey:
Classes/AWSPolly.html#/c:objc(cs)AWSPoll.abstract: Creates a service client with the given service configuration and registers it for the key.

Classes/AWSPolly.html#/c:objc(cs)AWSPoll.name: +PollyForKey:
Classes/AWSPolly.html#/c:objc(cs)AWSPoll.abstract: Retrieves the service client associated with the key. You need to call + registerPollyWithConfiguration:forKey: before invoking this method.

Classes/AWSPolly.html#/c:objc(cs)AWSPoll.name: +removePollyForKey:
Classes/AWSPolly.html#/c:objc(cs)AWSPoll.abstract: Removes the service client associated with the key and release it.

Classes/AWSPolly.html#/c:objc(cs)AWSPoll.name: -deleteLexicon:
Classes/AWSPolly.html#/c:objc(cs)AWSPoll.abstract:
Deletes the specified pronunciation lexicon stored in an AWS Region. A lexicon which has been deleted is not available for speech synthesis, nor is it possible to retrieve it using either the GetLexicon or ListLexicon APIs.

For more information, see Managing Lexicons.

Classes/AWSPolly.html#/c:objc(cs)AWSPoll.name: -deleteLexicon:completionHandler:
Classes/AWSPolly.html#/c:objc(cs)AWSPoll.abstract:
Deletes the specified pronunciation lexicon stored in an AWS Region. A lexicon which has been deleted is not available for speech synthesis, nor is it possible to retrieve it using either the GetLexicon or ListLexicon APIs.

For more information, see Managing Lexicons.

Classes/AWSPolly.html#/c:objc(cs)AWSPoll.name: -describeVoices:
Classes/AWSPolly.html#/c:objc(cs)AWSPoll.abstract:
Returns the list of voices that are available for use when requesting speech synthesis. Each voice speaks a specified language, is either male or female, and is identified by an ID, which is the ASCII version of the voice name.

When synthesizing speech ( SynthesizeSpeech ), you provide the voice ID for the voice you want from the list of voices returned by DescribeVoices.

For example, you want your news reader application to read news in a specific language, but giving a user the option to choose the voice. Using the DescribeVoices operation you can provide the user with a list of available voices to select from.

You can optionally specify a language code to filter the available voices. For example, if you specify en-US, the operation returns a list of all available US English voices.

This operation requires permissions to perform the polly:DescribeVoices action.

Classes/AWSPolly.html#/c:objc(cs)AWSPoll.name: -describeVoices:completionHandler:
Classes/AWSPolly.html#/c:objc(cs)AWSPoll.abstract:
Returns the list of voices that are available for use when requesting speech synthesis. Each voice speaks a specified language, is either male or female, and is identified by an ID, which is the ASCII version of the voice name.

When synthesizing speech ( SynthesizeSpeech ), you provide the voice ID for the voice you want from the list of voices returned by DescribeVoices.

For example, you want your news reader application to read news in a specific language, but giving a user the option to choose the voice. Using the DescribeVoices operation you can provide the user with a list of available voices to select from.

You can optionally specify a language code to filter the available voices. For example, if you specify en-US, the operation returns a list of all available US English voices.

This operation requires permissions to perform the polly:DescribeVoices action.

Classes/AWSPolly.html#/c:objc(cs)AWSPoll.name: -getLexicon:
Classes/AWSPolly.html#/c:objc(cs)AWSPoll.abstract: Returns the content of the specified pronunciation lexicon stored in an AWS Region. For more information, see Managing Lexicons.

Classes/AWSPolly.html#/c:objc(cs)AWSPoll.name: -getLexicon:completionHandler:
Classes/AWSPolly.html#/c:objc(cs)AWSPoll.abstract: Returns the content of the specified pronunciation lexicon stored in an AWS Region. For more information, see Managing Lexicons.

Classes/AWSPolly.html#/c:objc(cs)AWSPoll.name: -getSpeechSynthesisTask:
Classes/AWSPolly.html#/c:objc(cs)AWSPoll.abstract: Retrieves a specific SpeechSynthesisTask object based on its TaskID. This object contains information about the given speech synthesis task, including the status of the task, and a link to the S3 bucket containing the output of the task.

Classes/AWSPolly.html#/c:objc(cs)AWSPoll.name: -getSpeechSynthesisTask:completionHandler:
Classes/AWSPolly.html#/c:objc(cs)AWSPoll.abstract: Retrieves a specific SpeechSynthesisTask object based on its TaskID. This object contains information about the given speech synthesis task, including the status of the task, and a link to the S3 bucket containing the output of the task.

Classes/AWSPolly.html#/c:objc(cs)AWSPoll.name: -listLexicons:
Classes/AWSPolly.html#/c:objc(cs)AWSPoll.abstract: Returns a list of pronunciation lexicons stored in an AWS Region. For more information, see Managing Lexicons.

Classes/AWSPolly.html#/c:objc(cs)AWSPoll.name: -listLexicons:completionHandler:
Classes/AWSPolly.html#/c:objc(cs)AWSPoll.abstract: Returns a list of pronunciation lexicons stored in an AWS Region. For more information, see Managing Lexicons.

Classes/AWSPolly.html#/c:objc(cs)AWSPoll.name: -listSpeechSynthesisTasks:
Classes/AWSPolly.html#/c:objc(cs)AWSPoll.abstract: Returns a list of SpeechSynthesisTask objects ordered by their creation date. This operation can filter the tasks by their status, for example, allowing users to list only tasks that are completed.

Classes/AWSPolly.html#/c:objc(cs)AWSPoll.name: -listSpeechSynthesisTasks:completionHandler:
Classes/AWSPolly.html#/c:objc(cs)AWSPoll.abstract: Returns a list of SpeechSynthesisTask objects ordered by their creation date. This operation can filter the tasks by their status, for example, allowing users to list only tasks that are completed.

Classes/AWSPolly.html#/c:objc(cs)AWSPoll.name: -putLexicon:
Classes/AWSPolly.html#/c:objc(cs)AWSPoll.abstract:
Stores a pronunciation lexicon in an AWS Region. If a lexicon with the same name already exists in the region, it is overwritten by the new lexicon. Lexicon operations have eventual consistency, therefore, it might take some time before the lexicon is available to the SynthesizeSpeech operation.

For more information, see Managing Lexicons.

Classes/AWSPolly.html#/c:objc(cs)AWSPoll.name: -putLexicon:completionHandler:
Classes/AWSPolly.html#/c:objc(cs)AWSPoll.abstract:
Stores a pronunciation lexicon in an AWS Region. If a lexicon with the same name already exists in the region, it is overwritten by the new lexicon. Lexicon operations have eventual consistency, therefore, it might take some time before the lexicon is available to the SynthesizeSpeech operation.

For more information, see Managing Lexicons.

Classes/AWSPolly.html#/c:objc(cs)AWSPoll.name: -startSpeechSynthesisTask:
Classes/AWSPolly.html#/c:objc(cs)AWSPoll.abstract: Allows the creation of an asynchronous synthesis task, by starting a new SpeechSynthesisTask. This operation requires all the standard information needed for speech synthesis, plus the name of an Amazon S3 bucket for the service to store the output of the synthesis task and two optional parameters (OutputS3KeyPrefix and SnsTopicArn). Once the synthesis task is created, this operation will return a SpeechSynthesisTask object, which will include an identifier of this task as well as the current status.

Classes/AWSPolly.html#/c:objc(cs)AWSPoll.name: -startSpeechSynthesisTask:completionHandler:
Classes/AWSPolly.html#/c:objc(cs)AWSPoll.abstract: Allows the creation of an asynchronous synthesis task, by starting a new SpeechSynthesisTask. This operation requires all the standard information needed for speech synthesis, plus the name of an Amazon S3 bucket for the service to store the output of the synthesis task and two optional parameters (OutputS3KeyPrefix and SnsTopicArn). Once the synthesis task is created, this operation will return a SpeechSynthesisTask object, which will include an identifier of this task as well as the current status.

Classes/AWSPolly.html#/c:objc(cs)AWSPoll.name: -synthesizeSpeech:
Classes/AWSPolly.html#/c:objc(cs)AWSPoll.abstract: Synthesizes UTF-8 input, plain text or SSML, to a stream of bytes. SSML input must be valid, well-formed SSML. Some alphabets might not be available with all the voices (for example, Cyrillic might not be read at all by English voices) unless phoneme mapping is used. For more information, see How it Works.

Classes/AWSPolly.html#/c:objc(cs)AWSPoll.name: -synthesizeSpeech:completionHandler:
Classes/AWSPolly.html#/c:objc(cs)AWSPoll.abstract: Synthesizes UTF-8 input, plain text or SSML, to a stream of bytes. SSML input must be valid, well-formed SSML. Some alphabets might not be available with all the voices (for example, Cyrillic might not be read at all by English voices) unless phoneme mapping is used. For more information, see How it Works.

Classes/AWSPollyVoice.html#/c:objc(cs)AW.name: additionalLanguageCodes
Classes/AWSPollyVoice.html#/c:objc(cs)AW.abstract:
Additional codes for languages available for the specified voice in addition to its default language.

For example, the default language for Aditi is Indian English (en-IN) because it was first used for that language. Since Aditi is bilingual and fluent in both Indian English and Hindi, this parameter would show the code hi-IN.

Classes/AWSPollyVoice.html#/c:objc(cs)AW.name: identifier
Classes/AWSPollyVoice.html#/c:objc(cs)AW.abstract: Amazon Polly assigned voice ID. This is the ID that you specify when calling the SynthesizeSpeech operation.

Classes/AWSPollyVoice.html#/c:objc(cs)AW.name: languageName
Classes/AWSPollyVoice.html#/c:objc(cs)AW.abstract: Human readable name of the language in English.

Classes/AWSPollyVoice.html#/c:objc(cs)AW.name: name
Classes/AWSPollyVoice.html#/c:objc(cs)AW.abstract: Name of the voice (for example, Salli, Kendra, etc.). This provides a human readable voice name that you might display in your application.

Classes/AWSPollyVoice.html#/c:objc(cs)AW.name: supportedEngines
Classes/AWSPollyVoice.html#/c:objc(cs)AW.abstract: Specifies which engines (standard or neural) that are supported by a given voice.

Classes/AWSPollySynthesizeSpeechOutput.h.name: contentType
Classes/AWSPollySynthesizeSpeechOutput.h.abstract:
Specifies the type audio stream. This should reflect the OutputFormat parameter in your request.

  • If you request mp3 as the OutputFormat, the ContentType returned is audio/mpeg.

  • If you request ogg_vorbis as the OutputFormat, the ContentType returned is audio/ogg.

  • If you request pcm as the OutputFormat, the ContentType returned is audio/pcm in a signed 16-bit, 1 channel (mono), little-endian format.

  • If you request json as the OutputFormat, the ContentType returned is audio/json.

Classes/AWSPollySynthesizeSpeechInput.ht.name: engine
Classes/AWSPollySynthesizeSpeechInput.ht.abstract: Specifies the engine (standard or neural) for Amazon Polly to use when processing input text for speech synthesis. Using a voice that is not supported for the engine selected will result in an error.

Classes/AWSPollySynthesizeSpeechInput.ht.name: languageCode
Classes/AWSPollySynthesizeSpeechInput.ht.abstract:
Optional language code for the Synthesize Speech request. This is only necessary if using a bilingual voice, such as Aditi, which can be used for either Indian English (en-IN) or Hindi (hi-IN).

If a bilingual voice is used and no language code is specified, Amazon Polly will use the default language of the bilingual voice. The default language for any voice is the one returned by the DescribeVoices operation for the LanguageCode parameter. For example, if no language code is specified, Aditi will use Indian English rather than Hindi.

Classes/AWSPollySynthesizeSpeechInput.ht.name: lexiconNames
Classes/AWSPollySynthesizeSpeechInput.ht.abstract: List of one or more pronunciation lexicon names you want the service to apply during synthesis. Lexicons are applied only if the language of the lexicon is the same as the language of the voice. For information about storing lexicons, see PutLexicon.

Classes/AWSPollySynthesizeSpeechInput.ht.name: outputFormat
Classes/AWSPollySynthesizeSpeechInput.ht.abstract:
The format in which the returned output will be encoded. For audio stream, this will be mp3, ogg_vorbis, or pcm. For speech marks, this will be json.

When pcm is used, the content returned is audio/pcm in a signed 16-bit, 1 channel (mono), little-endian format.

Classes/AWSPollySynthesizeSpeechInput.ht.name: sampleRate
Classes/AWSPollySynthesizeSpeechInput.ht.abstract:
The audio frequency specified in Hz.

The valid values for mp3 and ogg_vorbis are “8000”, “16000”, “22050”, and “24000”. The default value for standard voices is “22050”. The default value for neural voices is “24000”.

Valid values for pcm are “8000” and “16000” The default value is “16000”.

Classes/AWSPollySynthesizeSpeechInput.ht.name: speechMarkTypes
Classes/AWSPollySynthesizeSpeechInput.ht.abstract: The type of speech marks returned for the input text.

Classes/AWSPollySynthesizeSpeechInput.ht.name: text
Classes/AWSPollySynthesizeSpeechInput.ht.abstract: Input text to synthesize. If you specify ssml as the TextType, follow the SSML format for the input text.

Classes/AWSPollySynthesizeSpeechInput.ht.name: textType
Classes/AWSPollySynthesizeSpeechInput.ht.abstract: Specifies whether the input text is plain text or SSML. The default value is plain text. For more information, see Using SSML.

Classes/AWSPollySynthesizeSpeechInput.ht.name: voiceId
Classes/AWSPollySynthesizeSpeechInput.ht.abstract: Voice ID to use for the synthesis. You can get a list of available voice IDs by calling the DescribeVoices operation.

Classes/AWSPollySynthesisTask.html#/c:ob.name: creationTime
Classes/AWSPollySynthesisTask.html#/c:ob.abstract: Timestamp for the time the synthesis task was started.

Classes/AWSPollySynthesisTask.html#/c:ob.name: engine
Classes/AWSPollySynthesisTask.html#/c:ob.abstract: Specifies the engine (standard or neural) for Amazon Polly to use when processing input text for speech synthesis. Using a voice that is not supported for the engine selected will result in an error.

Classes/AWSPollySynthesisTask.html#/c:ob.name: languageCode
Classes/AWSPollySynthesisTask.html#/c:ob.abstract:
Optional language code for a synthesis task. This is only necessary if using a bilingual voice, such as Aditi, which can be used for either Indian English (en-IN) or Hindi (hi-IN).

If a bilingual voice is used and no language code is specified, Amazon Polly will use the default language of the bilingual voice. The default language for any voice is the one returned by the DescribeVoices operation for the LanguageCode parameter. For example, if no language code is specified, Aditi will use Indian English rather than Hindi.

Classes/AWSPollySynthesisTask.html#/c:ob.name: lexiconNames
Classes/AWSPollySynthesisTask.html#/c:ob.abstract: List of one or more pronunciation lexicon names you want the service to apply during synthesis. Lexicons are applied only if the language of the lexicon is the same as the language of the voice.

Classes/AWSPollySynthesisTask.html#/c:ob.name: outputFormat
Classes/AWSPollySynthesisTask.html#/c:ob.abstract: The format in which the returned output will be encoded. For audio stream, this will be mp3, ogg_vorbis, or pcm. For speech marks, this will be json.

Classes/AWSPollySynthesisTask.html#/c:ob.name: sampleRate
Classes/AWSPollySynthesisTask.html#/c:ob.abstract:
The audio frequency specified in Hz.

The valid values for mp3 and ogg_vorbis are “8000”, “16000”, “22050”, and “24000”. The default value for standard voices is “22050”. The default value for neural voices is “24000”.

Valid values for pcm are “8000” and “16000” The default value is “16000”.

Classes/AWSPollySynthesisTask.html#/c:ob.name: snsTopicArn
Classes/AWSPollySynthesisTask.html#/c:ob.abstract: ARN for the SNS topic optionally used for providing status notification for a speech synthesis task.

Classes/AWSPollySynthesisTask.html#/c:ob.name: speechMarkTypes
Classes/AWSPollySynthesisTask.html#/c:ob.abstract: The type of speech marks returned for the input text.

Classes/AWSPollySynthesisTask.html#/c:ob.name: taskId
Classes/AWSPollySynthesisTask.html#/c:ob.abstract: The Amazon Polly generated identifier for a speech synthesis task.

Classes/AWSPollySynthesisTask.html#/c:ob.name: taskStatus
Classes/AWSPollySynthesisTask.html#/c:ob.abstract: Current status of the individual speech synthesis task.

Classes/AWSPollySynthesisTask.html#/c:ob.name: taskStatusReason
Classes/AWSPollySynthesisTask.html#/c:ob.abstract: Reason for the current status of a specific speech synthesis task, including errors if the task has failed.

Classes/AWSPollySynthesisTask.html#/c:ob.name: textType
Classes/AWSPollySynthesisTask.html#/c:ob.abstract: Specifies whether the input text is plain text or SSML. The default value is plain text.

Classes/AWSPollySynthesisTask.html#/c:ob.name: voiceId
Classes/AWSPollySynthesisTask.html#/c:ob.abstract: Voice ID to use for the synthesis.

Classes/AWSPollyStartSpeechSynthesisTask.name: synthesisTask
Classes/AWSPollyStartSpeechSynthesisTask.abstract: SynthesisTask object that provides information and attributes about a newly submitted speech synthesis task.

Classes/AWSPollyStartSpeechSynthesisTask.name: engine
Classes/AWSPollyStartSpeechSynthesisTask.abstract: Specifies the engine (standard or neural) for Amazon Polly to use when processing input text for speech synthesis. Using a voice that is not supported for the engine selected will result in an error.

Classes/AWSPollyStartSpeechSynthesisTask.name: languageCode
Classes/AWSPollyStartSpeechSynthesisTask.abstract:
Optional language code for the Speech Synthesis request. This is only necessary if using a bilingual voice, such as Aditi, which can be used for either Indian English (en-IN) or Hindi (hi-IN).

If a bilingual voice is used and no language code is specified, Amazon Polly will use the default language of the bilingual voice. The default language for any voice is the one returned by the DescribeVoices operation for the LanguageCode parameter. For example, if no language code is specified, Aditi will use Indian English rather than Hindi.

Classes/AWSPollyStartSpeechSynthesisTask.name: lexiconNames
Classes/AWSPollyStartSpeechSynthesisTask.abstract: List of one or more pronunciation lexicon names you want the service to apply during synthesis. Lexicons are applied only if the language of the lexicon is the same as the language of the voice.

Classes/AWSPollyStartSpeechSynthesisTask.name: outputFormat
Classes/AWSPollyStartSpeechSynthesisTask.abstract: The format in which the returned output will be encoded. For audio stream, this will be mp3, ogg_vorbis, or pcm. For speech marks, this will be json.

Classes/AWSPollyStartSpeechSynthesisTask.name: outputS3BucketName
Classes/AWSPollyStartSpeechSynthesisTask.abstract: Amazon S3 bucket name to which the output file will be saved.

Classes/AWSPollyStartSpeechSynthesisTask.name: outputS3KeyPrefix
Classes/AWSPollyStartSpeechSynthesisTask.abstract: The Amazon S3 key prefix for the output speech file.

Classes/AWSPollyStartSpeechSynthesisTask.name: sampleRate
Classes/AWSPollyStartSpeechSynthesisTask.abstract:
The audio frequency specified in Hz.

The valid values for mp3 and ogg_vorbis are “8000”, “16000”, “22050”, and “24000”. The default value for standard voices is “22050”. The default value for neural voices is “24000”.

Valid values for pcm are “8000” and “16000” The default value is “16000”.

Classes/AWSPollyStartSpeechSynthesisTask.name: snsTopicArn
Classes/AWSPollyStartSpeechSynthesisTask.abstract: ARN for the SNS topic optionally used for providing status notification for a speech synthesis task.

Classes/AWSPollyStartSpeechSynthesisTask.name: speechMarkTypes
Classes/AWSPollyStartSpeechSynthesisTask.abstract: The type of speech marks returned for the input text.

Classes/AWSPollyStartSpeechSynthesisTask.name: text
Classes/AWSPollyStartSpeechSynthesisTask.abstract: The input text to synthesize. If you specify ssml as the TextType, follow the SSML format for the input text.

Classes/AWSPollyStartSpeechSynthesisTask.name: textType
Classes/AWSPollyStartSpeechSynthesisTask.abstract: Specifies whether the input text is plain text or SSML. The default value is plain text.

Classes/AWSPollyStartSpeechSynthesisTask.name: voiceId
Classes/AWSPollyStartSpeechSynthesisTask.abstract: Voice ID to use for the synthesis.

Classes/AWSPollyPutLexiconInput.html#/c:.name: content
Classes/AWSPollyPutLexiconInput.html#/c:.abstract: Content of the PLS lexicon as string data.

Classes/AWSPollyPutLexiconInput.html#/c:.name: name
Classes/AWSPollyPutLexiconInput.html#/c:.abstract: Name of the lexicon. The name must follow the regular express format [0-9A-Za-z]{1,20}. That is, the name is a case-sensitive alphanumeric string up to 20 characters long.

Classes/AWSPollyListSpeechSynthesisTasks.name: nextToken
Classes/AWSPollyListSpeechSynthesisTasks.abstract: An opaque pagination token returned from the previous List operation in this request. If present, this indicates where to continue the listing.

Classes/AWSPollyListSpeechSynthesisTasks.name: synthesisTasks
Classes/AWSPollyListSpeechSynthesisTasks.abstract: List of SynthesisTask objects that provides information from the specified task in the list request, including output format, creation time, task status, and so on.

Classes/AWSPollyListSpeechSynthesisTasks.name: maxResults
Classes/AWSPollyListSpeechSynthesisTasks.abstract: Maximum number of speech synthesis tasks returned in a List operation.

Classes/AWSPollyListSpeechSynthesisTasks.name: nextToken
Classes/AWSPollyListSpeechSynthesisTasks.abstract: The pagination token to use in the next request to continue the listing of speech synthesis tasks.

Classes/AWSPollyListSpeechSynthesisTasks.name: status
Classes/AWSPollyListSpeechSynthesisTasks.abstract: Status of the speech synthesis tasks returned in a List operation

Classes/AWSPollyListLexiconsOutput.html#.name: lexicons
Classes/AWSPollyListLexiconsOutput.html#.abstract: A list of lexicon names and attributes.

Classes/AWSPollyListLexiconsOutput.html#.name: nextToken
Classes/AWSPollyListLexiconsOutput.html#.abstract: The pagination token to use in the next request to continue the listing of lexicons. NextToken is returned only if the response is truncated.

Classes/AWSPollyListLexiconsInput.html#/.name: nextToken
Classes/AWSPollyListLexiconsInput.html#/.abstract: An opaque pagination token returned from previous ListLexicons operation. If present, indicates where to continue the list of lexicons.

Classes/AWSPollyLexiconAttributes.html#/.name: alphabet
Classes/AWSPollyLexiconAttributes.html#/.abstract: Phonetic alphabet used in the lexicon. Valid values are ipa and x-sampa.

Classes/AWSPollyLexiconAttributes.html#/.name: languageCode
Classes/AWSPollyLexiconAttributes.html#/.abstract: Language code that the lexicon applies to. A lexicon with a language code such as “en” would be applied to all English languages (en-GB, en-US, en-AUS, en-WLS, and so on.

Classes/AWSPollyLexiconAttributes.html#/.name: lastModified
Classes/AWSPollyLexiconAttributes.html#/.abstract: Date lexicon was last modified (a timestamp value).

Classes/AWSPollyLexiconAttributes.html#/.name: size
Classes/AWSPollyLexiconAttributes.html#/.abstract: Total size of the lexicon, in characters.

Classes/AWSPollyLexicon.html#/c:objc(cs).name: content
Classes/AWSPollyLexicon.html#/c:objc(cs).abstract: Lexicon content in string format. The content of a lexicon must be in PLS format.

Classes/AWSPollyGetSpeechSynthesisTaskOu.name: synthesisTask
Classes/AWSPollyGetSpeechSynthesisTaskOu.abstract: SynthesisTask object that provides information from the requested task, including output format, creation time, task status, and so on.

Classes/AWSPollyGetSpeechSynthesisTaskIn.name: taskId
Classes/AWSPollyGetSpeechSynthesisTaskIn.abstract: The Amazon Polly generated identifier for a speech synthesis task.

Classes/AWSPollyGetLexiconOutput.html#/c.name: lexicon
Classes/AWSPollyGetLexiconOutput.html#/c.abstract: Lexicon object that provides name and the string content of the lexicon.

Classes/AWSPollyGetLexiconOutput.html#/c.name: lexiconAttributes
Classes/AWSPollyGetLexiconOutput.html#/c.abstract: Metadata of the lexicon, including phonetic alphabetic used, language code, lexicon ARN, number of lexemes defined in the lexicon, and size of lexicon in bytes.

Classes/AWSPollyDescribeVoicesOutput.htm.name: nextToken
Classes/AWSPollyDescribeVoicesOutput.htm.abstract: The pagination token to use in the next request to continue the listing of voices. NextToken is returned only if the response is truncated.

Classes/AWSPollyDescribeVoicesOutput.htm.name: voices
Classes/AWSPollyDescribeVoicesOutput.htm.abstract: A list of voices with their properties.

Classes/AWSPollyDescribeVoicesInput.html.name: engine
Classes/AWSPollyDescribeVoicesInput.html.abstract: Specifies the engine (standard or neural) used by Amazon Polly when processing input text for speech synthesis.

Classes/AWSPollyDescribeVoicesInput.html.name: includeAdditionalLanguageCodes
Classes/AWSPollyDescribeVoicesInput.html.abstract: Boolean value indicating whether to return any bilingual voices that use the specified language as an additional language. For instance, if you request all languages that use US English (es-US), and there is an Italian voice that speaks both Italian (it-IT) and US English, that voice will be included if you specify yes but not if you specify no.

Classes/AWSPollyDescribeVoicesInput.html.name: languageCode
Classes/AWSPollyDescribeVoicesInput.html.abstract: The language identification tag (ISO 639 code for the language name-ISO 3166 country code) for filtering the list of voices returned. If you don’t specify this optional parameter, all available voices are returned.

Classes/AWSPollyDescribeVoicesInput.html.name: nextToken
Classes/AWSPollyDescribeVoicesInput.html.abstract: An opaque pagination token returned from the previous DescribeVoices operation. If present, this indicates where to continue the listing.

Classes/AWSPollyDeleteLexiconInput.html#.name: name
Classes/AWSPollyDeleteLexiconInput.html#.abstract: The name of the lexicon to delete. Must be an existing lexicon in the region.

Classes/AWSPollyLexicon.html.name: AWSPollyLexicon
Classes/AWSPollyLexicon.html.abstract: Provides lexicon name and lexicon content in string format. For more information, see Pronunciation Lexicon Specification (PLS) Version 1.0.

Classes/AWSPollyLexiconAttributes.html.name: AWSPollyLexiconAttributes
Classes/AWSPollyLexiconAttributes.html.abstract: Contains metadata describing the lexicon such as the number of lexemes, language code, and so on. For more information, see Managing Lexicons.

Classes/AWSPollySynthesisTask.html.name: AWSPollySynthesisTask
Classes/AWSPollySynthesisTask.html.abstract: SynthesisTask object that provides information about a speech synthesis task.

Classes/AWSPolly.html.name: AWSPolly
Classes/AWSPolly.html.abstract:
Amazon Polly is a web service that makes it easy to synthesize speech from text.

The Amazon Polly service provides API operations for synthesizing high-quality speech from plain text and Speech Synthesis Markup Language (SSML), along with managing pronunciations lexicons that enable you to get the best results for your application domain.
